data.name: EDUCATION SUPPORT IN BANGLADESH
data.description: The quality of education in Bangladesh remains low. The most essential measure of quality in a school system is whether its students are learning the foundational skill for all future learning: reading. In Bangladesh most children are not acquiring basic reading fluency.
data.author: Abdullah Azad

data.name: FOOD PORGRAM IN BANGLADESH
data.description: Food assistance in the form of cash allows participants in the public works programmes to be paid cash wages which are useful in themselves in alleviating poverty and in helping to improve food security. Participants can also, however, be paid directly in the form of food (food-for-work).
data.author: Moidul Hasan

data.name: HELP SAVE CHILDREN IN BANGLADESH
data.description: Bangladesh has made remarkable progress in reducing child mortality in recent decades. Yet 1 child in every 33 still dies from a preventable or treatable cause â€“ half of these are newborns. The children of Bangladesh also face malnutrition, child marriage, lack of education and more, risking their very lives and futures.
data.author: Najim Uddin
